lessons.title: Native vs Exotic
lessons.content: When choosing trees for your local environment, it's crucial to understand the difference between native and exotic species. Native trees are those that have evolved in a particular region over thousands of years. They are well-adapted to the local climate, soil, and wildlife. Exotic trees, on the other hand, are introduced from other regions. While some exotics can be beneficial, many can become invasive, out-competing native species for resources and disrupting the local ecosystem.

lessons.title: Understanding Soil Types
lessons.content: Soil is not just dirt; it's a complex mixture of minerals, organic matter, gases, liquids, and countless organisms. The main types of soil are sand, silt, and clay. Most soils are a combination of these three. Understanding your soil type is the first step to successful tree planting.
